summary: The Employee Ownership Representation Act of 2025 amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA). It expands the membership of the Advisory Council on Employee Welfare and Pension Benefit Plans to include two representatives from employee ownership organizations. This aims to give employee ownership groups a voice in advising the Secretary of Labor on matters related to employee welfare and pension plans. The Secretary of Labor is required to nominate the first two representatives within a year of the bill's enactment.
